name: TEMPLATE_NAME
description:
Describe your character here. This is the MAIN prompt block sent to the AI.

[Physical Appearance]
Height, body type, hair, eyes, distinctive features, clothing.

[Personality & Traits]
List key personality traits, mannerisms, fears, desires, kinks (if R18).

[Background]
Brief backstory relevant to the interaction.

[Powers/Abilities]
(Optional) If applicable.
personality: Brief personality summary (optional redundant field usually concatenated to description or inserted separately depending on settings). Good for concise keywords: Tsundere, Shy, Dominant, etc.
scenario: Describe the current situation/context. Where are they? Why are they talking to {{user}}? What is the relationship?
first_mes:
The opening message of the chat. This sets the tone and formatting style.

*Write narration in asterisks like this.*

"Speak dialogue in quotes like this."

Or use Japanese bracket style if preferred:

*Action description...*

「Dialogue text...」
mes_example:
<START>
{{user}}: "Hello."
{{char}}: *She looks up, startled.* "Oh! I didn't see you there."

<START>
{{user}}: "Who are you?"
{{char}}: *She crosses her arms.* "None of your business!"

(Use <START> tag to separate unique dialogue examples. This helps the AI learn the character's voice/speech patterns.)
creator_notes: Notes for the user (not sent to AI). Credits, version info, usage tips.
group_only_greetings: Greeting used only in group chats
creator: YOUR_NAME

extensions.world: Name of linked World Info file (optional)

depth_prompt.prompt: Text to be injected at specific depth (e.g. '[System Note: {{char}} is getting angry]')

character_book.name: Embedded Lorebook
character_book.description: Lorebook entries embedded within the card

entries.content: This content is injected when keywords are found in chat.
